peripheral.title: Additional Interface
peripheral.help_text:
The audio digital filter (ADF) is a high-performance module dedicated to the connection of external sigma-delta (ΣΔ) modulators.
It is mainly targeted for the following applications:
- audio capture signals
- metering

Camera can refer to the following:
• camera connector for DCMI signals
• camera module of 1.3 Mpixel up to 5 MPixel

DFSDM stands for Digital Filter for Sigma-Delta Modulators. The IP behaves like
a standard analog-to-digital converter (ADC) with the analog part outside the microcontroller.

This peripheral is in charge of the Media Access Control layer of Ethernet communication.
It is fully compliant with the IEEE 802.3 standard. The peripheral is involved in applications based
on internet networks. Such applications rely on the TCP/IP layer model. The MAC is in charge of the link
layer of TCP/IP communication model.

The I2C (inter-integrated circuit) bus interface handles communications between the
microcontroller and the serial I2C bus. It provides multimaster capability, and controls all I2C
bus-specific sequencing, protocol, arbitration and timing. It supports Standard-mode (Sm), Fast-mode (Fm)
and Fast-mode Plus (Fm+).

HDMI-CEC (High Definition Multimedia Interface Consumer Electronics Control) is
the appendix supplement 1 to the HDMI standard. It is a protocol which provides high-level
control functions between all of the various audiovisual products in an environment.
It is specified to operate at low speeds with minimum processing and memory overhead.

The multi-function digital filter (MDF) is a high-performance module dedicated to the connection of external sigma-delta (ΣΔ) modulators.
It is mainly targeted for the following applications:
- audio capture signals
- motor control
- metering

The SPDIFRX (Sony Philips Digital InterFace Receiver) is designed to receive an S/PDIF flow compliant
with IEC-60958 and IEC-61937. These standards support simple stereo streams up to high sample rate,
and compressed multi-channel surround sound, such as those defined by Dolby or DTS (up to 5.1).

The SAI (Serial Audio Interface) is integrated in STM32 products to provide an interface,
for communicating with external audio devices such as amplifiers, ADCs, DACs, audio codecs and audio processors.

The SDMMC (Secure Digital MMC) is a non-volatile memory card format developed
by the SD Card Association (SDA) for use in portable devices.

The SDIO (Secure Digital IO) is a non-volatile memory card format developed by
the SD Card Association (SDA) for use in portable devices.
Voltage reference buffer management.
